The exception likely should not happening at all.  Technically speaking it is 
not an error to install a bundle with no manifest (or plugin/fragment.xml).  It 
is somewhat pathalogical but the framework likely handles it.  The error we are 
getting here is because the converter *really* wants to run (there is no 
manifest) and there is are no xml files to convert.

In debug mode perhaps we would report more information (e.g., "installed a 
bundle with no manifest")

How do you have a framework fragment with out a bundle manifest?  You need to 
at least specify:

Bundle-SymbolicName: cds
Fragment-Host: org.eclipse.osgi

I do agree that the PluginConverter should not fail in this case.  But you 
will likely have other issues.  I'm pretty sure you need at least a Bundle-
SymbolicName to be included in a feature, right?

yes and no.  the fragment needs a manifest to go in a feature but features are 
not required.  So I can install bundles without features and without a 
manifest.  As I say, it is pathological but it shouldn't fail.
Let's see if we can do a two line fix for RC2.

releasing bug ownership.

I looked into this fix but it turns out to be more that a two line fix.  There 
are several places in the converter which expect a valid manifest to be 
generated.  If we do not bail with a PluginConverterException then there are 
several places (both in the converter impl and clients) that will need to 
change to prevent NPEs.
No intention of fixing this right now. Will need a convincing use case in order to change PluginConvertor code.
